name: Indian Adult Education
objective: To improve the educational opportunities for Indian adults who lack the level of literacy skills necessary for effective citizenship and productive employment and to encourage the establishment of adult education programs.

results.description: Indian Affairs (IA) successfully fulfilled program objective; 16 Self-Determination awards issued to Indian Tribes in FY 20.
Indian Affairs issued 19 new awards and modifications to existing awards to 17 recipients.
Awards 2 grants to entities to complete the goals and objectives of the program.
This award funded 22 programs such as: higher education program, adult vocational training, and occupational training program.

authorizations.text: Snyder Act of 1921, Public Law 67-85, 25 U.S.C. 13; Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act, Public Law 93-638, as amended; Public Law 103-413, Title II Tribal Self-Governance Act.
